intro: Quiina micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered quiina, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are usually palmately lobed and have a distinctive, somewhat hairy texture. Quiina micrantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
